Name: English
Description: A West Germanic language originating in England, now widely spoken around the world.

Name: Spanish
Description: A Romance language that originated in the Iberian Peninsula and is now the primary language of Spain and Latin America.

Name: French
Description: A Romance language of the Indo-European family, widely spoken in France, parts of Canada, and several African countries.

Name: German
Description: A West Germanic language mainly spoken in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, and parts of Belgium and Italy.

Name: Chinese
Description: A group of languages that form the Sinitic branch of the Sino-Tibetan languages, with Mandarin being the most spoken.

Name: Arabic
Description: A Central Semitic language that first emerged in Iron Age northwestern Arabia and is now the lingua franca of the Arab world.

Name: Portuguese
Description: A Romance language originating in the Iberian Peninsula, primarily spoken in Portugal and Brazil.

Name: Russian
Description: An East Slavic language and an official language in Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, and Kyrgyzstan.

Name: Japanese
Description: An East Asian language spoken primarily in Japan, known for its complex system of honorifics and three scripts.

Name: Dutch
Description: A West Germanic language spoken by about 24 million people as a first language and 5 million as a second language, mainly in the Netherlands and Belgium.

Name: Italian
Description: A Romance language spoken mainly in Italy and Switzerland.

Name: Korean
Description: The official language of South Korea and North Korea, with a unique writing system called Hangul.

Name: Hindi
Description: An Indo-Aryan language spoken mainly in India, and one of the official languages of the country.

Name: Urdu
Description: An Indo-Aryan language spoken primarily in Pakistan and India, written in a script derived from Arabic.

Name: Hebrew
Description: A Northwest Semitic language native to Israel, and the liturgical language of the Jewish people.

Name: Turkish
Description: A Turkic language primarily spoken in Turkey and Cyprus.

Name: Swedish
Description: A North Germanic language spoken natively by 10 million people, predominantly in Sweden and parts of Finland.

Name: Danish
Description: A North Germanic language spoken primarily in Denmark and in some regions of Greenland and the Faroe Islands.

Name: Norwegian
Description: A North Germanic language spoken primarily in Norway, with two standard written forms: Bokmål and Nynorsk.

Name: Finnish
Description: A Finno-Ugric language spoken by the majority of the population in Finland and by ethnic Finns outside Finland.

Name: Polish
Description: A West Slavic language spoken primarily in Poland and is the native language of the Poles.

Name: Thai
Description: The official language of Thailand, belonging to the Kra-Dai language family.

Name: Vietnamese
Description: The national and official language of Vietnam, and a member of the Austroasiatic language family.

Name: Greek
Description: A Hellenic language spoken primarily in Greece and Cyprus, known for its rich history and contribution to Western culture.

Name: Hungarian
Description: A Finno-Ugric language spoken primarily in Hungary and by Hungarian communities in neighboring countries.

Name: Czech
Description: A West Slavic language spoken primarily in the Czech Republic, closely related to Slovak.

Name: Slovak
Description: A West Slavic language spoken primarily in Slovakia, closely related to Czech.

Name: Bulgarian
Description: A South Slavic language spoken primarily in Bulgaria, using the Cyrillic alphabet.

Name: Romanian
Description: A Romance language spoken primarily in Romania and Moldova.

Name: Ukrainian
Description: An East Slavic language spoken primarily in Ukraine, using the Cyrillic alphabet.

Name: Croatian
Description: A South Slavic language spoken primarily in Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and by Croats in other neighboring countries.

Name: Serbian
Description: A South Slavic language spoken primarily in Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, and Croatia.

Name: Malay
Description: A major language of the Austronesian family spoken in Malaysia, Indonesia (as Indonesian), Brunei, and Singapore.

Name: Tagalog
Description: An Austronesian language spoken primarily in the Philippines; Filipino, the national language, is based on Tagalog.

Name: Indonesian
Description: The standardized form of Malay and the official language of Indonesia.

Name: Burmese
Description: The official language of Myanmar (Burma), a member of the Sino-Tibetan language family.

Name: Persian
Description: A Western Iranian language spoken primarily in Iran, Afghanistan (as Dari), and Tajikistan (as Tajik).
